Question: Heilmeier Question: What are you trying to do? (Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon.)
For a user: list out skills, techniques, procedures, understanding and/or knowledge (i.e., capability) provided by the software.
What data capabilities will be provided by the software?
Heilmeier Question: What is new in your approach and why do you think it will be successful?
Are new technology capabilities provided from the software? (e.g., meaningful AI or ML interfacing where non exists)
For an organization: What NEW capabilities are gained with the software?
Is current capability lost when developing this software, and can they be mitigated?
What human resources are necessary to execute the software project?
What are the limitations on available resources to enable software development?
What are the technical requirements and expertise necessary for software development?
Is new infrastructure necessary to execute the software project?
What opportunities are created by the software (i.e., Heilmeier Question: what difference will this make)?
Does this enable innovation opportunities for other users or organizations?
What collaboration opportunities are created by the software development?
Can existing solutions speed the development for the software?
Does the software enhance other solutions/capabilities?
Can other organizations be leveraged for similar software/approaches?
Are there means or methods to expand the software beyond its initial scope? (e.g., can it enable an API? Do the outputs have 'downstream' value?)
Do existing solutions work 'well enough' (Heilmeier Question: how is it done today, what are current practice limits)?
What are the constraints on the software development process, are any imposed by external stakeholders?
For organization strategic goals: does this software development effort fit? (i.e., are we 'supposed to develop software?')
Can existing solutions be modified with techniques, tactics, and procedures to achieve this software's capability?
If other organizations have similar approaches, why does this software need to be created?
What benefits/advantages are expected from the software development?
When is the software going to be usable? (Heilmeier Question: What are the mid-term and final 'exams'; Minimal Viable Product and Minimum Viable Capability Release)?
How many users and non-direct users can leverage the software or its outputs (e.g., market demand)?
(Expanded) What is the timeline for software development and how does that impact resource allocation?
For existing options: how is the software more valuable, and/or different?
What is the expected lifespan of the software?
What is the expected maintenance of the software?
What is the estimated cost (time, money) (i.e. what return on investment is gained) from the software development?
What are the financial resources available for software development?
What are the legal and regulatory constraints on the software development process?
